name: snowy sampler quilt
description:
Made as part of a block of the month pattern from Jeni Baker's blog, In Color Order.  The soft colors and mixed blend of prints make this lap quilt one of my favorites.

The quilt is made up of 12 sampler blocks and was machine pieced and quilted.  It's bordered with a grey dot and bound with a cursive text print.  All fabrics and threads are 100% cotton and the batting is Warm and White.  The back is pieced bands of coordinating prints in shades of grey and white.

Gentle cycle cold wash is recommended along with tumbling dry on low or line drying.  This quilt has been washed and dried once so it is perfectly crinkly.

name: blue cross quilt
description:
Ready for tummy time, this black, white, and blue quilt is the perfect thing for baby to play on.

It's 43" x 43" and made up of many black and white and black and off-white prints that have been cut into 2" squares, along with little flecks of blue, here and there. I added a big blue cross at the bottom to bring out the scattered bits of blue. It is machine pieced. The blue binding was attached by machine and finished by hand. The back is an adorable zoo print with a small band of blue on one side. It is machine quilted in gold with a wondering diagonal pattern. 

All fabrics are 100% cotton. The batting is Warm & Natural. As with most handmade goods, I would recommend a gentlest cycle with line drying when possible, but can be machine dried on low. I have washed and dried the quilt once already to achieve that cozy puckering look.

name: basket of chips quilt
description:
Inspired by my son's love of potato chips, this queen size quilt will keep you cozy without the calories.

It is 93" x 86".  The central panel is made up of 4 oversized blocks that are based on a traditional block found in the book Encyclopedia of Quilt Patterns, listed as #713 Basket of Chips.  Yellow, green, and orange became my colors of choice because my son's favorite potato chips are regular, sour cream and onion, and cheddar and sour cream.  The borders are a study in precision piecing of triangles.  

This quilt is machine pieced and machine quilted with 100% cotton thread.  The quilting runs in diagonal lines across the quilt.  It's bound with a green dot print.  The back is pieced with a mix of coordinating colors and prints.

All fabrics are 100% cotton.  The batting is Warm and White.  I recommend the gentlest cycle for washing and line drying when possible.  A quilt of this size tends to roll into a ball in the dryer, so it will take forever to dry.  I find I have the best luck with line drying most of the way and finishing with a low temp tumble to fluff the quilt.  I have washed and dried this quilt once already.

name: bright star flowers quilt
description:
Bright floral prints mixed with a solid grey using traditional quilt blocks make for one happy quilt.  The block patterns are from tutorials on Faith Jones' blog, Fresh Lemon Quilts.  The quilt includes the Solstice Star blocks along with some blocks from the Summer Sampler Series.

It is quilted with a light grey thread in parallel lines running 1/2" apart from each other.  The back of the quilt is a single piece of yellow and blue print of doilies and roses.  All fabrics and threads are 100% cotton.  The batting is Warm and White.

I recommend washing this quilt on the gentlest cycle with cold water and tumble dry on low or line dry.

I have washed and dried this quilt once already.

name: floral stripe quilt
description:
Bold colors plus bold patterns makes for a bold baby quilt.

This 54" x 38" quilt was machine pieced using 100% cotton fabrics and bound with a tiny houndstooth check in gold.  It was machine quilted with 100% cotton, gold thread in diagonal lines running 1" apart from each other.

The quilt back is a solid piece of a stylized floral print in golds and pinks.

As with most handmade goods, I recommend washing this quilt on the gentlest cycle or by hand with cold water.  Tumble dry on low or line dry.

name: scooter kids stripe quilt
description:
Three courthouse step log cabin blocks frame scenes of kids riding scooters along with their pups on this lap quilt.

Made up of strips, this machine pieced quilt is a mix of greys, blues, and whites with pink highlights.  It is 50" x 40", all fabrics and threads are 100% cotton, and the batting is Warm and White.  It was machine quilted with light grey thread in vertical lines that run 1 1/2" apart from each other.  The back is a single piece fabric with large grey paisleys on an off white field.  It is bound with a polka dot print of multi-colored dots on charcoal grey.

I recommend washing on the gentlest cycle with cold water and tumbling dry on the lowest setting.
